sentence.text: Nicotine is contained in the moisture of the tobacco leaf : when the cigarette is lit , it evaporates , attaching itself to minute droplets in the tobacco smoke inhaled by the smoker .
When a pregnant woman smokes she inhales various poisons , including nicotine and carbon monoxide , which are absorbed into her body and pass to the baby .
Sara stood in the road and inhaled warm , clean country air in which she could distinguish the smell of the sea from a hint of the gorse on the hills .
Released from his pipe , at least momentarily , he inhaled the morning air .
She sighed and then inhaled the sweet scented air .
With every breath he inhaled the warm , womanly scent of her , and , as she gradually began to relax , his body began to tauten .
Ruth deeply inhaled the scent of the pines so richly sweet , warm and Mediterranean .
He inhaled the smoke with obvious pleasure .
Connors lit a cigarette and nodded as he inhaled the smoke .
She inhaled deeply , savouring the smoke , then turned .
Morris inhaled smoke , held it for some minutes , and then let it out down his nose .
Before you go , Sister Clarey will give you a Vitalograph to test your lungs to make sure you have n't inhaled any harmful vapours from this stuff . "
If he fails , he inhales the disgusting muck in which he is mired .
Still other male mice spent a single four-hour period inhaling nitrous oxide before being put with females ( none of which had been exposed to hazardous chemicals ) .
An aftershave bottle spilled its contents and Scott inhaled the aroma momentarily before stepping back .
Her lungs burned as she inhaled foam ; she vomited .
ICI claimed this was not harmful to residents in the area and they had only received a small number of complaints from people who had inhaled the gas .
However , the team of Medical Research Council researchers based at Edinburgh 's Western General Hospital are hoping to refine the gene complex into a spray which can be inhaled by human sufferers .
Smokeless tobacco can be inhaled , chewed or sucked and , as with smoking , can cause cancer in humans -- most particularly cancers of the oral cavity .
She inhaled the aroma of his thick black coffee and looked with some doubt at her murky cup of tea .
Merseyside Coroner Roy Barter told the Liverpool hearing that she must have inhaled the bacteria as it floated through the air as vapour from a contaminated hot water outlet .
She inhaled the heady perfume to avoid looking into his compelling eyes .
She inhales deeply and goes on .
Urquhart inhaled deeply and flexed his firm jaw .
Each member of the group inhaled from the can , and some felt a strange effect , rather like being drunk .
Then the movement is reversed : the air inside , now heated , escapes through the same pores whereby it entered , and is replaced by cold air inhaled through the mouth
Manfred inhaled powerfully through his nose and held his breath while he stared at the stars and listened to the tiny howl of life in his ears .
Anthea inhaled sharply , and her nostrils flared .
He inhaled slowly , allowing the breath to escape gradually from between slightly parted lips before answering .
He inhaled and exhaled .
